alert.note: Alert for Kaufman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 11:07PM CDT until further notice by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Kaufman County in North Texas. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Mesquite, Ennis, Terrell, Seagoville, Forney, Kaufman, Sunnyvale, Mabank, Crandall, Combine, Talty, Seven Points, Kemp, Grays Prairie, Cottonwood, New Terrell City Lake, Cedar Creek Reservoir, Elmo and Scurry.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
